attributes.action: Prevent the Sale of Energy Drinks to Children under 16 years of Age
attributes.additional_details:
NHS - http://www.nhs.uk/news/2011/05May/Pages/energy-drinks-and-children.aspx
Hyperactivity and Inattention Linked to Energy Drinks - http://www.additudemag.com/adhdblogs/19/11170.html
http://www.caffeineinformer.com/is-energy-drink-overdose-in-teens-really-a-problem
https://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/2015/jun/11/children-are-using-energy-drinks-but-are-they-being-sold-responsibly
attributes.background:
Potential risks associated with energy drinks include:
Caffeine Overdose (symptoms, including palpitations, high blood pressure, nausea, convulsions &, even death)  Type 2 Diabetes – Neurological and Cardiovascular system  - Sensation-Seeking Behaviour - Dependence on other harmful substances
